places_with_reviews.name: Shri Kankaleshwar Temple
places_with_reviews.address: Kanakaleshwar Premises, Momin Pura Road, near Ambedkar Statue, Mominpura, Beed, Bid Rural, Maharashtra 431122, India

reviews.text: A wonderful temple which is situated in middle of a pond. We went around 8 pm and the temple has the pooja and closure around that time. The Pujari said opening poojas and alankaras happen as early as 3 am to 5 am daily.

Nice peaceful place.
But the transportation is not good.

Must visit temple for its architecture. Kind of unknown gem. Very less folks are aware of such a magnificent temple in Beed.

The temple is surrounded with water. The source of water is underground water. One have to wade through the water. See photos to understand.

One of its kind of temple. Worth detour if you are around Beed.

A very beautiful place for the devotee.
The temple is good with nice architecture and idols.

The temple is very beautiful and built with an enormous thought process but after taking a closer look at it,you will realise it is purposefully destroyed.There are few Lingas ,Naga and Nandi just kept outside the temple premises below the baniyan tree.I believe they must be part of Temple but purposefully taken out to destroy the power of the place.Government should pay attention and take the necessary actions.Also temple and surrounding area was not clean.

reviews.text:

Nice place to visit, especially in navratri season.
Great place to visit in beed city.historical place well maintained and must have to visit.

The Sukoon you feel while entering this temple is something which everyone craves for ..❣

places_with_reviews.name: Sri Sri Radha Govind Temple ISKCON Beed
places_with_reviews.address: 2Q26+HCJ, New Mondha Rd, Sawata Nagar, Beed, Maharashtra 431122, India

reviews.text: Awesome Temple and with very good positive vibes , this is the first time I visited ISKCON temple. It was really a very good experience. Temple is under construction/renovation at the moment!

Very peaceful and spiritual place... You can sit here all day and just keep looking to Radha Krishna... Kirtana in the evening mesmerizes the environment even more...
Every Sunday after the kirtana and prayer, every devotee and can have yummy and delicious prasadam like khichdi, Dal chawal , pulao etc... this is a must visit place for everyone living in Beed.

The deities here, Sri Sri Radha Govinddevji are awesomely beautiful!!!

One of the must-visit places in the town.

Thank you 🙇
Very Peaceful Environment to connect with Lord Krishna 🙏

Divine place , where world's beuty is present in the form of Shri Shri Radha Govindji. Nice beautiful architecture of temple and pieceful place with gardens , goshala  , river banked and can  get nice gifts in gift-shop.

places_with_reviews.name: Shani Maharaj Temple
places_with_reviews.address: XQW8+MCW bhagwan transports, Vipra Nagar, Beed, Maharashtra 431122, India

reviews.text:
One of the main shani maharaj shakti peeth temple in India..
Powerful.place ..... Must visit during saade saati, to minimize the negative impact of saade saati...

Located in beed city... Car Parking not available beside temple...

Located within a kilometer from beed bus stand...
Ancient Hindu open tample. Here is no roof on Shanidev tample.

Nice place... This is half shaktipeeth among three and half shaktipeeth of Lord Shani... there is no roof top to this temple... it is believed that Vikramaditya has spent last two and half year during Saturn transit period here.. Old well you can see here... Easy to reach here.. Good place to visit...

Nice and simple construction, 1st of a kind temple with no roof. It is said that, anything that comes between Shani Shila and sun, is destroyed. May be that's the reason, even trees cannot cover it. None of the building here has locks  on their doors, do notice it when you visit. The accomodation facilities in bhakta nivas is very good and spacious, at affordable rates.

places_with_reviews.name: Khazana Well
places_with_reviews.address: WQW2+MHX, Beed - Solapur Rd, Aher wadgaon, Maharashtra 431122, India

reviews.text: We Help Foundation team always keeps its clean request you all for the same.
Old well ...water was too clean when I visited...you can easily see bottom...it is said that water level never goes down through out the year.

Critical engineering to full fill the water requirements in beed city in anciant time..
Maharani Champavati spend lot of money for    project...
A historical well,a masterpiece of engineering.Today also in a good condition.Fishes in it add a beauty to it and cathes attraction of tourists.

Historical well, good place to visit to have look how the irrigation system was well planned in Nizam period. Need more cleanliness of the well and surrounding areas.
Khazana Well was constructed in 991 AH (1583) by Salabat Khan, a Jagirdar of Beed in the period of Murtaza Nizam Shah of Ahmadnagar. It is said that the water level in this well remains unchanged even in droughts. Three currents of water start from the well and irrigate the land of Barg o Zar (meaning ‘Leaves and Flowers’, pronounced in colloquial as Balguzar) around the town.
